website_summaries.verdict: A heavy-duty steel hitch step that will last you for many years without rusting or falling apart.
pros: Made of carbon steel with a black powder-coat finish
Sturdy hitch step won't bend or break off
cons: The step can be slippery when it gets wet
A few users have said that it is wobbly

customer_reviews.title: As others have said, it fits loosely into the ...
customer_reviews.text: As others have said, it fits loosely into the hitch. It's slippery. But, it's solid steel. You're not going to hurt it if you experiment with the step. I used 3M grip tape to solve the slip issue for $6 and 20 minutes of cut & paste.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Beaver Step Parking Intimidator / Educator
customer_reviews.text: Go ahead - get right up on my bumper...😜 Stowaway Hitch Tightener - took the rattle out - unit fit loose in my 2" hitch... Sprayed the unit with Rustoleum Truck Bed Liner for a non-slip finish...
customer_reviews.author: Reginald Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Terrible fit
customer_reviews.text: Terrible fit in a 2” receiver. Too sloppy to use as a step as it flops around, even with the hitch pin installed. I read other reviewers wrapped tape around the unit to try to secure a snug fit. For this kind of money, It should be designed to fit a 2” receiver, the most common trailer hitch on vehicles. It is a well made, heavy piece, the specifications should have been more exacting for what it is used for, a step. I returned it and bought something else.
customer_reviews.author: Juneau2003

customer_reviews.title: WIFE HATED IT, TILL A KID WAS TEXTING AND HIT ...
customer_reviews.text: WIFE HATED IT, TILL A KID WAS TEXTING AND HIT HER AT A LIGHT. Our 4 runner was un-scratched, his car was totaled.
customer_reviews.author: David Cotrone

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but I expected more attention to detail from Smittybilt
customer_reviews.text: Super beefy. Looks nothing like the studio picture. It's one solid piece of cast steel, coated in a thick paint (not powder coated, but hey...) My only issues are: 1. super slick, and slippery. stepping on this with wet shoes or in is trouble. I added non slip tape. 2. A little wobbly in my 2" receiver. Again, if you are gonna step on something out in the rain/muck, it's nice if it didn't wobble. 3-4 wraps with electrical tape in front, and behind the holes does the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: Beware tailgaters
customer_reviews.text: Man, this is one piece of heavy steel!! I put this on my 2014 f150 fx2. It does fit a bit loose, so I went ahead and purchased the hitch tightener to fasten it down and it has a perfect fit now. I also bought grit texture flat black and sprayed a few coats on it to add a better grip. Looks really cool on the truck. Good add on and shipping was super fast.
customer_reviews.author: TPAGE

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: Very very sturdy piece, perfect step I needed(I couldn't find an excellent folding step so went with this). I didn't like the glossier black look(everything else on my rig is satin black), so I took a Scotch Brite pad to the finish and dulled it down. Then a friend wrapped the top in 3M no-slip "skateboard deck" tape; that works amazing in not slipping, as otherwise the finish on this piece is friggin' WAY TOO slick when it's wet. Definitely add some no-slip grip tape to this. Also, it fit a bit loose into my 2" hitch receiver, so I applied some felt tape to this step which doesn't allow it to make any noise anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy W.

customer_reviews.title: Very loose fit
customer_reviews.text: As others mentioned - it is very wobbly and fits very loose. I did a bit of tape wrapping to try and reduce the wobble but it is hard to get it perfectly tight. I decided to keep it as the primary reason I bought it was as a tailgating deterrent after I got rear-ended. Figured the sharp pointy piece of steel would encourage distracted drivers to keep eye on the gap. To that end it does the job pretty well. However - it you plan to use it as a step aid or for towing - you may want to consider other products.
customer_reviews.author: m

customer_reviews.title: Sort of fits a 2 inch receiver....
customer_reviews.text: This step is built solid. I was suprised how heavy it was, it weights about 20 lbs. That being said, it's a bit small for a 2 inch receiver. It really wants to rotate in the socket, which for a step is kind of scary! It won't because of the pin, but this thing really moves around. I sort of fixed this by wrapping the part that goes into the receiver with electrical tape. It still moves, but less so. For the price of this, I would like to see more precision. Note this thing is loud when you go over bumps due to the excessive play in the fit. On the plus side, it is pretty nice looking
customer_reviews.author: DeKalb Land Man

customer_reviews.title: 15 Pounds Of Solid Steel
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid piece of steel and survived shipping without any damage to the black coating. As other have mentioned a little loose in the receiver but I also installed a hitch tightener which I believe is required if this is to be used as a step. I will be adding some nonslip tape in the next few days. I will be using this on my 2017 Jeep JK as a step, recovery point and rear protection from careless drivers. Seems like it should do all of these function very well. Wish it was made in the US as I try to purchase made in the US as much as possible.
customer_reviews.author: WLH

customer_reviews.title: Great trailer hitch step!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these for my F-150 and it is very helpful for getting access to things in the bed of my truck without having to drop the rear lift gate. It is all steel...very heavy construction. I liked it so much I just bought a second one and installed it on my 4-Runner. The 4-Runner does not have much of a bumper so it will give a modicum of protection in case needed and is a convenient step to reach the roof and luggage rack for cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Rock solid, heavy little beast of an add-on.
customer_reviews.text: Product is solid as hell. Only issue I have with it is the hitch pin area is smaller than most anything I've used, so if you hit a bump you definitely hear it. Sounds like you just lost your bumper every time you hit a bump... I'm gonna have to wrap it in something to fill the void, so it doesn't bounce around back there like it does. Other than that it's amazing and for what you get, the price is pretty incredible too. Wouldn't hesitate to buy it again, just wish it fit the hitch tighter than it does.
customer_reviews.author: CGG

customer_reviews.title: Does what I bought it for.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a bump deterrent, and it definitely works. It's sometimes comical to see how far back people park when I'm backed into a parking spot. I have the same issues with this being loose in my receiver. I hope to fix it with some sort of shim, because I love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: TooMuchTech

customer_reviews.title: Beaver Step 1 - Honda CRV 0
customer_reviews.text: Love the beaver step!! Just the way the step looks (danger arrow) seems to slow people down behind me. Except for the other day... a new Honda CRV wanted to get in my personal space so bad that he damaged his front fairing. No damage on my truck, minus a little red on the step! The man must have been so embarrassed that he didn't even stop to check for my whiplash!! LOL As for a step, love the steadiness when used as such. I did put the hitch stabilizer on the step to make ridged. I would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: GR

customer_reviews.title: Useful accessory
customer_reviews.text: I've had my SUV since 2005 and towed something only once. I liked having a tow hitch and ball just in case some texting fool bumps into me, but using a 2" ball as a step isn't too great. This device is just perfect, but out of the box, it's smooth, so I scuffed up the top side a bit and sprayed some truck bed liner paint on it for some traction. This is a really solid piece of steel and seems to be more than strong enough for anything I could expect to encounter.
customer_reviews.author: chuckasaki

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, Strong, Durable.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this thing. It has to weigh at least 12 to 15 lbs, so you know it's a chunk of steel. The reason I did not give it 5 stars is because it fits sloppy in the receiver. Not sure why they can't make it bigger, but oh well. I ended up using duct tape to fill the gaps. It still moves some, but 90% better than it was. I also sprayed bed liner on the step to give it some traction. Without it, it is slick.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: A real disappointment & waste of steel
customer_reviews.text: NOT powder coat paint. Looks like cheap lacquer. Holes for pin are way oversized, Not circular, and jagged. They look like they were burned with a torch by an 8-year. It does look cool if you don't look too closely. Maybe these people need a new foundry in China.
customer_reviews.author: Robert G.Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Knowing I was going to have to modify due to other reviews......
customer_reviews.text: Same as others have said...loose fitting and slick. Knowing this going into it, I give or 4. Heavy duty chunk of iron. I spray it with Rustoleum bed liner....let it dry...then dipped the receiver end in flex seal. Nice and snug!!! Even the pin ended up perfect and tight.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: (super easy to trace template on paper and cut holes exact
customer_reviews.text: Switched to this from standard hitch trying to keep people from parking or traveling too close, not to mention needing to switch from standard hitch as my knees can't take much more of running into it. I added safety grip sandpaper with adhesive back as it can be slippery when wet. (super easy to trace template on paper and cut holes exact. The only improvement this could use for my application is be at least another 1-2 inches longer on the shaft and dual drill holes for pin location option. I love that I can stand on it and get items from the bed of truck with ease. Wish I had bought sooner.
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: Solid build but Not USA built.
customer_reviews.text: Very solid construction. Definitely will be a deterrent for people to not bump my bumper. Would recommend this product just disappointed this is not made in the US. Does say it is manufactured in China but overlooked that details. It would not have changed my decision to purchase, but for price I believed it was made in USA.
customer_reviews.author: Keawe Kaauwai

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, but the Beaver is actually a Wobbler
customer_reviews.text: Solid construction. Makes a good step into truck bed. But it has one big downside---it is way too small for a 2 inch hitch--it wobbles all over the place like nothing I have ever put in a hitch receiver before. Should you consider this product, you might want to look at getting a stabilizing attachment for it to reduce all the free play and clunking noise you would otherwise get. If it were not for this problem this would be a 4 star item.
customer_reviews.author: Tepozteco

customer_reviews.title: Very sloppy and loose fit in a 2" hitch. Unnacceptable.
customer_reviews.text: This product was NOT made for a 2" hitch. Extremely loose fit and very sloppy. Completely unacceptable. Disappointed in Smittybilt for putting out such a poor product.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry

customer_reviews.title: People really do notice it though so I recommend pairing it with at
customer_reviews.text: The BMW rubber plug was disappearing so I started using this fill my hitch when not using it. Every time I get to the dealer, another new guy asks where I bought it. It's certainly aggressive looking, but we've used it to pull people from the ditch, lower a gun safe into a basement and many other things. People really do notice it though so I recommend pairing it with at. I added that after I scared off some guys hanging around my car and found the spring clip had been removed!
customer_reviews.author: TallMeIrresponsible

customer_reviews.title: Good solid step/protection for the back of my truck
customer_reviews.text: Good solid step/protection for the back of my truck. As others mentioned, it is quite undersized for the 2" receiver (1/16-1/8" on all 4 sides), so it took a lot of building up all 4 sides to make a nice tight fit so it would not rattle around. Otherwise, heavy duty, good quality. Mine arrived with some scuffs on the powdercoating from shipping (not packaged too tightly in box for such a heave item), but no metal showing - and it is a step hanging on the back of truck outdoors for its life. So not big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Hinchman

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt fit as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: It doesnt fit a 2 inch hitch. Its too narrow. Sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Collar Guy

customer_reviews.title: People who park as if at a carnival ride beware.
customer_reviews.text: People who park as if at a carnival ride beware. This is very sturdy. Be careful when comparing as many other top brand models are made of plastic and only for use as a step and not protection. This is a step and will protect your rear end from bumper car type motorists.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kaufmann

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: First, let me say that I was thoroughly surprised by the sheer weight of this thing. It is heavy duty! It looks really sick, is large, and VERY sturdy! If someone were to rear end me with this installed they'd be screwed for sure hahaha My only complaint with it is that it sits a little loosely in my receiver. I have a standard 2" receiver but it has a decent amount of play. Enough that it clanks when going over speedbumps, but it's something I can live with.
customer_reviews.author: Brad S.

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty obvious the real purpose is a tailgating deterrent and ...
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty obvious the real purpose is a tailgating deterrent and spearhead meant to punish those who rear-end your vehicle. That's exactly why I got it. For the price it should fit tighter in a standard 2" receiver, but it only took a moment to wrap a layer of duct tape around the end so it doesn't rattle around. It is one solid piece of metal that is a lot heavier than I expected it to be. It would last a long time as a "step" or "tow hook" and I hope it never has to fulfill its purpose of protecting my precious pickup truck from a rear collision.
customer_reviews.author: DJB1

customer_reviews.title: Well made, needed one little tweak.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality powder coating. Seems well made. I used strips of an old bike innertube to be sure there was a good tight fit in the receiver (see photos). So NO chance of rattling or any noise, and won't shift under your foot. This thing weighs a good 20 lbs!
customer_reviews.author: SrirachaHOT

customer_reviews.title: The Smittybilt Beaver step protected my 2017 Ford F150 from a bad rear ended crash
customer_reviews.text: As Customer Michael M stated back in 2015, The Smittybilt Beaver step protected my 2017 Ford F150 from a bad rear ended crash. the Vehicle struck me from behind while I was stopped in traffic. the 2nd drivers vehicle had sufficient bumper front end damage. although this product was not intended for this action, it shows the strength and quality built that you will receive with this beaver step. highly recommended...
customer_reviews.author: drenalin

customer_reviews.title: Great step!
customer_reviews.text: Seller delivered a day sooner than promised. Product is solid and appears to be well coated. As others mentioned, there's some wiggle room in my two inch hitch but some duct or electrical tape solves that. I'm happy with the value and hope its strength is never tested in a fender bender.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: The step definitely defines the rear of the vehicle.
customer_reviews.text: Similar to the experiences of others, the step does fit loosely in my 2007 Yukon's hitch-mount. However, that was easily rectified with a few wraps of duct tape. To make the step even more usable, I added some grip-tape to the top surface (something that should've been applied at the factory) and a length of .5" black reflective tape to the posterior edge. The step definitely defines the rear of the vehicle and makes the parking-lot clowns think twice about using your rear bumper to measure their parking efforts.
customer_reviews.author: RogaMan

customer_reviews.title: Well made and perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.text: This is primarily a step for my 2019 F-150 4WD. As other reviewers have noted the item arrived in a mangled box. It didn’t matter since it is essentially a chunk of steel. Others have noted a poor fit. The fit of mine is no different than my other drawbars tow hooks and receiver shackles. All of them rattle when not loaded. I wrapped the shank with duct tape to tighten it up and will coat it with spray-on bed liner to add non-skid. The step is generally what I expected and perfect for my needs. I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Everritt

customer_reviews.title: It does rattle like everyone says.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the Smitty Built because they make good stuff. But like everyone else I found it to flap around because it was smaller than receiver and rattled. To fix that I took someone’s suggestion and also bought the Hitch Titan. It tightened up the whole assembly and is a good detourant for thieves.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Weed

customer_reviews.title: Like everything from Smithybilt
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a "car-warming" present - my son just got a new Tahoe 4x4 that sets kind of high and has a separate rear window and tail gate. To get into the back end of the vehicle when only the window is open is a stretch even for him and he is over 6 ft. I first looked at some less expensive versions of this step but was concerned that they would not stand up to 200+ lbs and being bumped from behind, etc. Like everything from Smithybilt, this is build to last. The thing weighs a bunch but if you want a sturdy step and back bumper protection as well you cannot do better.
customer_reviews.author: J. Marsh

customer_reviews.title: Strong but wobbly.
customer_reviews.text: Very solid and sturdy step/protector. I am sure this will save my rear if someone decides to rear end me. Only issue is it wobbles pretty good. I am going to use some electrical tape until I can find out a better solution. maybe I will weld something over it, not sure yet.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Bean

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great city hitch, i park on busy streets an this certainly save my rear bumper from bumps. its round edged, so when you bang your knees against ( and you will with any hitch) it it wont hurt as much. Its heavy and solid so it doesnt bounce around while driving. I used a locking pin to prevent it from getting stolen.
customer_reviews.author: ricardo serna

customer_reviews.title: Great hitch step!
customer_reviews.text: This is one "meaty" hitch step. Do not drop it on your toes while installing cause it would hurt. Perfect for getting to your ladder racks while leaving tail gate in closed position. Rear bumper protection as well as this thing is built like a tank! Looks great as well due to it's design, one of a kind. Need one, don't hesitate to buy this, you won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Peter B

customer_reviews.title: People don't tailgate me as much as they used to.
customer_reviews.text: Looks bad a$$ and keeps people off my tail end. First time my wife used my truck at Walmart she parked in the back 40 like I do. When she came out someone had parked behind her so close they mashed their license plate in against this step and didn't even know it. This is a good preventative measure against inexperienced drivers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: decent
customer_reviews.text: does shake around a bit, might do what others have said and just wrap it in hockey tape. I have an anti-rattle piece from a Go-Rhino step; I might drill/tap it and use the anti-rattle on this one instead though. also, it IS made in China for those wondering. Didn't even know there were any Smittys (Smith) in China
customer_reviews.author: john a

customer_reviews.title: Protect your rear bumper!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the beaver tail mainly as a detterent for bumping my trucks rear end but it looks cool and functions nicely as a step although it may be a little slippery. Like many others that reviewed this product I added a hitch tightener to eliminate the rattle, this make the beaver tail rock solid. I also added a locking pin to deter theft. I did reduce one star because it arrived poorly package and had a few chips in the coating. Overall very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: rolson1

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy step
customer_reviews.text: Mine fit a 2014 jeep GC 2 inch receiver perfectly and tightly, no rattle no movement whatsoever. It would be nice if it had a non-slip top surface, but that is easily added by a bit of grip tape. Very nice for the height challenged missus in getting into the cargo area, or standing on it to reach the top of the jeep for either of us.. Side benefit is that it makes me feel more secure in parking lots, as it looks sturdy enough to protect the backup sensors from touch parkers. Doesn't interfere with the backup sensors at all, and is easily visible in the backup camera--particularly with yellow striped non skid tape applied to the top.
customer_reviews.author: Lon

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money, even if it's just to protect your bumper
customer_reviews.text: Not only is this a great step it also helps keep people from tailgating and from bumping your vehicle. I've been bumped a few times in drivethru lines, been hit while parked, and noticed people don't get as close to my car while driving. It's been hit and barely has any scratches. It's tough, strong, and gets attention. I've had several people ask about it. My neighbor purchased one too. He's used it to tow a few vehicles with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: larisa

customer_reviews.title: very heavy, well built
customer_reviews.text: ya know the kind of people who LOVE to tailgate you? They look at this on the back of my car and start jumping all over in their seat. They hate it. It makes a great deterrent. Nice step to get at the Kayaks. Only wish it were a little bit thicker.
customer_reviews.author: G. Herman

customer_reviews.title: 2017 Nissan Frontier Pro 4x
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid piece of metal. I have no doubt it'll do what it's designed to do. I had to dremel some leftover slag in the pin hole but that's no big deal. It will rattle in the reciever if you don't do something about it, for a temporary solution I just squeezed some weather stripping foam in with it, no rattling for now but i think I'll plasti dip it later.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Fits as loose as other reviews note
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy (weight). Nicely coated/sealed. Far, far too loose fitting in the hitch. Not just a little. After inserting, it is so loose that I did a double take and checked to be certain it was not poured for a 1 1/4" x 1 1/4" receiver. It will work, but I can't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: FlyNavy

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty and looks good
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a step to access the roof of my Toyota Sequoia. It is heavy duty. It is much safer than standing on the 2-inch ball. It is loose in the receiver as others have described. I attached some felt designed for use under furniture to solve that. It is powder coated, but I was concerned about traction in wet or muddy conditions. Reese makes a 4"x 15-1/2" self adhesive Sure Step EPDM rubber mat that I attached to the top for added traction.
customer_reviews.author: Luna's Opinion

customer_reviews.title: I like the fact that it can be adjusted either closer ...
customer_reviews.text: Definitely very strong, as advertised. I like the fact that it can be adjusted either closer or further from the vehicle. I'm concerned about the step being slippery when it is wet, so I installed anti-skid strips. I also added some reflective tape along the back edge. The fit was pretty loose (thus the four-star rating), so I expect that it could rattle a lot. Therefore, I wrapped some tape around it to tighten it up a bit. I was disappointed that it was not made in the USA. (China)
customer_reviews.author: Kawika

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the best accessory hitch add-on you can buy for it's intended purpose(s)!!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best accessory hitch/add-on you can buy!!! This is 100% solid, very heavy and made extremely well!!! I use it for a step, seat, holder at times and mostly to protect my back bumper from people bumping into the back of my new bumper. Really can't say enough great things about this product! Would highly recommend. Thick tough paint covered every inch of the step, solid solid solid! If I need another for any reason I will buy another of these for sure! Thank you for making a great quality product through and through!
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Nice hunk of steel but should fit more snug
customer_reviews.text: I wished the hitch would fit more snug like others have said, but I cut a scrap piece of leather, rubbed with Vaseline and it's quiet and snug. I also cut a pattern from a sheet of skate board tape to make it non-slip. I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Tuan

customer_reviews.title: STRONG and SOLID
customer_reviews.text: This is one solid piece of steel. Heavy. I bit sloppy fit in the receiver but one of those stabilizing clamps fixed that. It make a great step as well as a strong attaching point for a tow strap. I also like that it all painted so no worries about chrome rusting. If is ever needs it, just a light sanding and a coat of semigloss black paint and it will be as good as new.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Made in China. So that part sucks. Other than that, it is a solid and I mean solid piece of metal. A little slick when it gets wet. But very strong and very durable. Works fine with my back up sensors and camera. In fact it's what I use to judge when to stop. Good solid step but great tow hook too! Only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was because of where it was made and the price.
customer_reviews.author: Built2flex

customer_reviews.title: But best of all it keeps neighbors who are mechanically challenged ...
customer_reviews.text: This hitch allows you to tow things with tow straps. But best of all it keeps neighbors who are mechanically challenged from driving into your car when they park. I saw my neighbor look at my tow hitch and was desperately trying not to plow into my jeep but ends up backing into another car. Therefore this hitch did it's job.
customer_reviews.author: Happy person

customer_reviews.title: Amazing..
customer_reviews.text: Amazing...I love this product! It works extremely well for all of its intended uses. I did need to wrap the stem in a few layers of gorilla tape to help it fit well in my hitch receiver and not jiggle around. I have rescued a few vehicles off the beach with this and I use it as a step all the time.
customer_reviews.author: NICHOLAS T HOULIHAN

customer_reviews.title: Tell 'bump parkers' to back off
customer_reviews.text: Unusual hitch step/tow strap 'hook'. Doubles as an automatic spanking device for those who think parking is a contact sport. Solid and heavy steel construction is not just a suggestion. We, like many others needed tape wrapped foam to prevent sloppiness when placed into the hitch receiver...no biggy. Make sure you at least get a hitch lock or tightly bolt this to your receiver or someone will boost this stand out piece from your whip.
customer_reviews.author: FES

customer_reviews.title: Like it
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used this as a tow hook yet, but otherwise it's a nice sturdy hunk of metal!! I got it sprayed with Linex when I got my bed sprayed so it has a little grip on it when I use it as a step.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: so I had to wrap a good about of tape around it to keep it from ...
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy duty piece, the only issues that I have with it are that it is quite a bit too small to fit in the 2" opening, so I had to wrap a good about of tape around it to keep it from wiggling around. The other thing is that it has a super slippery finish on it, which does look nice. It needed to be wrapped in an anti-slip tape because even with it dry I would've fallen right off if reaching from something so I could only imagine if it was wet too.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Hefty!
customer_reviews.text: I'm 100% satisfied with this hitch step. It's very sturdy and it looks pretty cool. It also makes it easier for the kids to climb in the back of the truck. If you have a hook up for a trailer hitch I recommend you get one. It also acts as a great protection if you get rear ended by a car. A Toyota Camry hit me at a red light going about 35mph. Her car was totaled and my titan had little damage.
customer_reviews.author: adam

customer_reviews.title: Loose in hitch, crap from China. Strong though.
customer_reviews.text: Fits VERY loose in 2” receiver hitch. It Will rattle around, the cheap powder coat will wear off, and it will rust your hitch. Don’t want to have to buy a hitch tightener, and coating spray just for this to work how it should out of the box. I have yet to find a top quality, steel, hopefully American-made hitch step. This is definitely NOT it. China crap. On the plus side, It is strong, and I might keep it just as a potential recovery point.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: #3secondsapart
customer_reviews.text: Made it to the must list after a freeway domino crash this summer; class III only, very solid/heavy, only loose rattles on big bumps/holes. Remove before carwash to preserve the finish (color).
customer_reviews.author: td bleh

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid piece of steel, not hollow. This makes an excellent step for my kids to reach into the bed of my truck, and I've used it to attach a recovery strap to tow other vehicles.
customer_reviews.author: Steve-O

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: It's a loose fit (it can be wiggled several degrees side to side or up) in the factory hitch of a 2016 Tacoma, but it's built like a rock and makes getting into the bed easier. In the correct orientation, it will comfortably fit one size 16 men's shoe.
customer_reviews.author: KOB

customer_reviews.title: Best thing I've ever bought for my truck
customer_reviews.text: Best thing I've ever bought for my truck. Got hit from behind and this solid steel step took almost the entire impact of the accident. Without it my truck probably would have been totaled. I was only left with a couple dings and scratches. AWESOME!
customer_reviews.author: Jared T

customer_reviews.title: Good product. It needs non-slip tape or the like ...
customer_reviews.text: Good product. It needs non-slip tape or the like to be better. It needs reflective tape on the edges to be outstanding. It absolutely needs to be paired up with a Hitch Tightener from Mission Automotive or the like (here on Amazon) or it will rattle rattle rattle. I also recommend a locking hitch receiver pin to secure it from ever falling out on the road, or being stolen. It is a strong solid step for a fair price.
customer_reviews.author: A.  Reader

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty
customer_reviews.text: This thing is HEAVY! Wanted something to help protect the back of my truck from the people who seem to love to pull close at stoplights. Actually had a lady hit my truck once because she was texting and drifted forward. Luckily I still had my drop hitch with a trailer ball installed that day! It works well for that purpose, and is also very handy as a step to access the bed. It's a nice level to step up that's not too high and is wide enough to feel secure and safe using it. Very heavy duty.
customer_reviews.author: 505HandyGal

customer_reviews.title: Looks great!
customer_reviews.text: Like everyone else, I felt it move inside my 2" receiver but I used black tape to make it fit better. I got it mainly in case anyone slides into me this winter. It feels solid and I feel my truck's rear is well protected. It does not come with a pin. I got a locking 5/8 pin that worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: John W.

customer_reviews.title: Strong, functional step
customer_reviews.text: Great step up. Stable platform for stepping over into your pickup or as a strap attachment point for towing. As others mentioned, I had to wrap the receiver end with duct tape a couple times to make it fit a little better in my hitch. This doesn't effect the functionality, but it does make it ride a little quieter. Drilled for a 5/8" pin.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best buy bumper saver
customer_reviews.text: Much better than plastic Bump Step. Very heavy duty with good powder coat. Solid cast metal. Great price compared to cheap Rhino step . Will definitely save hundreds on hit bumper and looks cool. Still made in China but quality is very good. Rattles because of loose fit but easily fixed.
customer_reviews.author: bullcanvasback

customer_reviews.title: Fit is a little off but a Great product
customer_reviews.text: Strong as hell but needs a few mods. It will rattle but can easily be fixed with a few small pieces of foam padding and grip tape helped during the snow.... But it keeps people off your butt in the parking lot. Oh and if they do accidentaly tap you, the other car will most likely have a golf ball size dent on the license plate (it has happened more than once)
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: I Like It
customer_reviews.text: This thing is solid, heavy, and pretty cool. The fit within the receiver isn't the greatest but I can fix that by stuffing something in there. Some of the powder coating did chip off already, but I bet it was because someone hit it with their vehicle. Wish I could see the damage it did to their vehicle! I do recommend adding some grip tape to the top just in case its wet or greasy. I might even weld a bottle opener to the bottom of it.
customer_reviews.author: Jason H

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty
customer_reviews.text: This is a substantial piece of iron. I may need to stick some tread tape on it to avoid slipping when wet. Fit was good on my 2"receiver. I have a 2015 Sequoia if that matters. My primary reason for the purchase was to use it as a step when loading my vehicle. It also will discourage parking lot damage from folks who like park too close. I think it will work well with a tow strap but haven't used it that way.
customer_reviews.author: Sam D.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, very solid!
customer_reviews.text: Great solid product, I took the advice of another reviewer and got some step grip material to make it slip resistant. With very expensive sensors in my rear bumper, this is my first line of defense as a bumper protector.
customer_reviews.author: elizabeth clarkson

customer_reviews.title: Love the black color as it matches my black Toyota ...
customer_reviews.text: torn between giving ir 4 or 5 stars, I'll round up and give it 5. It's well built. Love the black color as it matches my black Toyota truck. Sturdy, clever design. It's a 2 receiver but fit a bit looser than the Reese Hitch and 3 ball hitch from Northern Tools I also have, but doesn't detract from the functionality. It's always good to have an extra step on back of truck, it's something different from other trailer hitches so there's the cool factor. Good price.
customer_reviews.author: John P.

customer_reviews.title: One giant chunk of steel.
customer_reviews.text: This bad boy is not something you'd want to put on your compact SUV, its so heavy you'd probably loose a couple MPG's. But no, seriously, its a solid piece of steel. I have people always asking me what it is, and I must say it is a very neat looking accessory. It's nothing less than heavy duty. My only complaint is its a loose fit so it rattles quite a bit when the Jeep hits the washboard roads. Besides that, very good job Smittybilt.
customer_reviews.author: 4Jeeps1Subaru

customer_reviews.title: Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: Solid hitch / bumper guard! Having been hit from behind before this hitch step is great. It is solid as a rock, it was made in China but it is still a solid piece. As a step to get to the roof rack it is functional but it's other use as a strap hitch point is great. For a quick tie down point for a tow strap this has been very convenient on a number of occasions.
customer_reviews.author: T. Rut.

customer_reviews.title: Beaver Step or boat anchor!?
customer_reviews.text: Any more solid, and it would be a boat anchor! For a SUV without a back bumper to stand on, this is a very important piece for vertically challenged folks when putting things on the roof. The coating is very good except for where the hitch pin goes. A little rust is already developing there, so lots of use of protectant spray to keep the pin from rusting into place.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Super strong
customer_reviews.text: Super tough, is a little loose on reciver hitch but I just added some tape so it does not rattle. Is slippery when wet so I added some traction tape which fixed the problem.
customer_reviews.author: russ

customer_reviews.title: MAD MAX hitch step
customer_reviews.text: This is one heavy duty hitch step. Fits a little loose but I knew that from all the reviews. I purchased this mostly to help me reach the roof during a car wash and for keeping people who can't drive off my brand new truck bumper. Also get a hitch lock to prevent it from walking off.
customer_reviews.author: K D

customer_reviews.title: Solid and heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: Heavy and very solid...only drawback is the fit into the receiver is loose so we have a very small bit of play which could annoy some people but a door shim driven in the top makes it quite solid... I sprayed it with black paint and sprinkled a bit of sand on teh step part then sparayed again after the sand was dried...makes for a sure step, no slip!
customer_reviews.author: Duncan Howser

customer_reviews.title: Its completely solid and is heavy which is nice, however it fits loose which i dont like
customer_reviews.text: Its completely solid and is heavy which is nice, however it fits loose which i dont like. Overall im satified it will do its job and go through someones radiator if they rear end me thats all that matters. Would be 5 stars easy if it went in snug!!
customer_reviews.author: gloy

customer_reviews.title: Solid and seems well made. The only gripe and ...
customer_reviews.text: Solid and seems well made. The only gripe and 4 star, is it does fit rather loosely in the hitch. I had to shim it with 20 inch bicycle innertube.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Buy this product
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy step, and intimidates the heck out of people behind you (kind of like a stinker or harpoon). But it will take any amount of abuse and is indestructible. I have used mine for almost a year and am completely happy with it. As an aside, bumpers are no longer meant to take a blow when backing up. I suspect that on some future occasion this step may save me some money.
customer_reviews.author: D. D. LeDu

customer_reviews.title: Rear end me now non-drivers!
customer_reviews.text: Rear ended twice in the last month- one that left without giving me their info. If I had this on, they wouldnt have gone anywhere lol. Works great as a step too. Lots of compliments and chuckles from its aggressive and effective appearance!
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Keep tailgaters at bay!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this thing! I feel like people keep more of their distance back when I have this on because they don't want to ruin the front of their car!! Makes the truck feel more aggressive too!
customer_reviews.author: NY Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Solid Chunk of Steel
customer_reviews.text: Wanted something to protect by rear bumper other than a ugly bar & ball hitch after I noticed someone with a red car had bumped into my white SUV . Solid chunk of black coated steel, looks cool & different from all the other hitch accessories I've seen. Hitch does have a little play when initially inserted into the receiver but as noted by other reviewers, a couple of wraps of electrical tape fixes that issue. Suggest 2 full wraps and use a sharp blade to cut out the hole for the pin.
customer_reviews.author: 808CRU

customer_reviews.title: We live in an area where people like to bump into you while they are parking
customer_reviews.text: I bought this step to save the bumper on my new Jeep Cherokee. We live in an area where people like to bump into you while they are parking. It seems to have kept the other drives away as no bumps yet. When friends ask what that is sticking out of the hitch mount I tell them it's to help my wife load things into the back. One gripe is that it fits loose and rattles a lot on gravel roads.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Some Issues
customer_reviews.text: A solid piece of metal with enamel coating. Heavy duty and made in China. Only issue is that the post is slightly undersized and the holes for the pin isn't exact. If you're leaving it in you would need rubber shims so it doesn't rattle down the road. Oh, and its slick when wet.
customer_reviews.author: C&K

customer_reviews.title: Solid and heavy, rear end step and protection from bumps.
customer_reviews.text: Deceptively heavy and solidly constructed. Fit in the receiver is a little loose, however, can be shimmed up with a few felt pads with no issues. Two pin holes allow you to adjust the depth a couple of inches. Anyone unlucky enough to bump into this thing is going to have a wrecked front end, great bump protection. Seems simple enough to be made in America, but is a product of China...only negative thing about it.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Love this guy. Put some reflector tape around it to be sure everyone knows it's there. Feels very durable. As other reviewers have said, they should have made it a bit wider. Feels loose in the hitch but doesn't bother me a ton.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome step.
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome step.. my only complaint is I wished it took up more space. It rattles a lot. I might see about getting it Rhinolined and seeing if that will take up some slack out of it... or if it'll quiet it down some.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Clendenny

customer_reviews.title: Save your bumper and your knees.
customer_reviews.text: Forged from a solid piece of Osmium this thing is dense and robust. It helps save my knees getting in and out of the back of a truck. I cannot hear any noises that come from this interacting with the receiver. As others have stated, it isn't a tight fit. I ended up adding non-skid tape to the surfaces where I step.
customer_reviews.author: Dayton Family of Four

customer_reviews.title: It's awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I literally bought this for tail gaters, it's solid steel, id hate to hit it, it's also a really great step!
customer_reviews.author: DMC

customer_reviews.title: Decent, but is a little loose
customer_reviews.text: Works great and I like the look. Haven't pulled out anybody using it yet, but as a step it's fine. The only problem I have is that it's a little loose and rattles going over bumps. Another issue is if you're barefoot and need to step up on it (beach driving, for example), you need to put on some sandals first.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Young

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, I have one on both my vehicles
customer_reviews.text: Perfect, I have one on both my vehicles. Makes a nice step. Makes a better dent in the front of cars when people bump you from behind. I had a texting driver hit me (rolling slow) at an intersection. This thing destroyed the front of his car and did nothing to mine. lol
customer_reviews.author: Jason B.

customer_reviews.title: Looks awesome, solid as a rock
customer_reviews.text: Awesome step! serves as well as a deterrent for driver getting too close to your rear end. It is a bit loose as others said, I am using a Hitch tightener and problem solved:
customer_reviews.author: Fab.

customer_reviews.title: The Beast!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome, giant hunk of steel hanging off the back of my SUV. Makes a great step for loading in the back or checking roof loads. It is a little wobbly, but it's not going anywhere, and I sure would hate to hit it with another car!
customer_reviews.author: VidProQuo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for step access and rear bumper protection
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for step access and rear bumper protection. Got rear ended a month ago and wished I had this on. Thankfully very little damage to the LR4 but will have none.
customer_reviews.author: Karissa Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Solid construction and heavy duty. I put it on my truck with a hitch lock so it is there whenever I need it. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Family

customer_reviews.title: nice looking & heavyweight
customer_reviews.text: Bought this not as much to use as a step but to help protect against rear end collision..been real ended 3x times this year. .nice looking & heavyweight. .will do damage to a car with the slightest hit..make sure you use a locking pin so one steals it.
customer_reviews.author: ken

customer_reviews.title: step works great. Loose fit in receiver so will have to ...
customer_reviews.text: Burly and its gonna leave a mark! step works great. Loose fit in receiver so will have to be shimmed or its going to make noise
customer_reviews.author: Zidaro

product_meta.title: Smittybilt 27046B Beaver Step for 2-Inch Hitch
product_meta.description: Smittybilt Beaver Step for 2-inch hitches is the simplest way to add a stepping point to get into your vehicle's bed or rear cargo area. The Beaver step is made from hammer forged carbon steel finished in a high gloss black powder coat. The Beaver step has multiple tow strap mounting points. It is designed to fit 2-inch hitch receivers and comes with a 10,000 pound rating.
feature_bullets: Hammer forged carbon steel finished in a high gloss black powder coat
Adds a stepping point to get into bed or rear cargo area
Cam'd speed lock system for fast and easy installation and removal
Fulcrum hinge system allows cover to roll back effortlessly
Truss (bow design) to prevent water/snow accumulations
Nylon reinforced plastic buckles - won't break or shatter

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars657 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
